Session.Abandon\ RedirectWithFlash "customers.asp", "You have been logged out."\ %>\ } ### FILE: includes/orders.asp {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf2867 \cocoatextscaling0\cocoaplatform0{\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} {\*\expandedcolortbl;;} \margl1440\margr1440\vieww11520\viewh8400\viewkind0 \pard\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920\tx8640\pardirnatural\partightenfactor0 \f0\fs24 \cf0 <%@ Language="VBScript" %>\ \ \ <%\ Option Explicit\ \ Call EnsureInMemoryData()\ Call RequireLogin()\ \ Dim action\ action = LCase(Trim(Request("action")))\ \ Select Case action\ Case "create"\ Call HandleCreate()\ Case "update"\ Call HandleUpdate()\ End Select\ \ Sub HandleCreate()\ Dim custId, status, total\ custId = CLng(0)\ status = Trim(Request.Form("status"))\ total = CDbl(0)\ \ On Error Resume Next\ custId = CLng(Request.Form("customerId"))\ total = CDbl(Request.Form("total"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ If custId <= 0 Or status = "" Or total <= 0 Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "All fields are required, total must be > 0."\ End If\ \ Dim orders, nextId\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ Application.Lock\ nextId = CLng(Application("NextOrderId"))\ orders.Add nextId, Array(custId, status, total, Now())\ Application("NextOrderId") = nextId + 1\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & nextId & " created."\ End Sub\ \ Sub HandleUpdate()\ Dim orderId, newStatus\ orderId = CLng(0)\ On Error Resume Next\ orderId = CLng(Request.Form("orderId"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ newStatus = Trim(Request.Form("newStatus"))\ If orderId <= 0 Or newStatus = "" Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order ID and new status are required."\ End If\ \ Dim orders\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ If Not orders.Exists(orderId) Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order not found."\ End If\ \ Dim data\ data = orders(orderId)\ \ Dim custId, total, createdAt\ custId = data(0)\ total = data(2)\ createdAt = data(3)\ \ Application.Lock\ orders(orderId) = Array(custId, newStatus, total, createdAt)\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & orderId & " updated."\ End Sub\ \ Call RenderHeader("Orders")\ %>\ \

IDCustomerStatusTotalCreatedUpdate status
<%=oid%><%=HtmlEncode(custName)%><%=HtmlEncode(status)%><%=FormatCurrency(total, 2)%><%=createdAt%>\

system_context_model.summary: This model represents the legacy ASP application components and their relationships, intended for modernization into a Python-based system.

convention_profile.summary: This profile outlines the coding conventions and standards observed in the legacy ASP codebase.

rules.rule: Session variables are used for authentication state management.

lint_recommendations: Ensure consistent naming conventions across all subroutines.
Refactor session management to use a more secure method.
scaffold_templates: Python Flask application structure with session management.

health_assessment.summary: The health assessment of the legacy codebase indicates areas that require modernization and improvement.

hotspots.reason: Session management is handled using insecure methods.

risks.title: Insecure Session Management
risks.description: The current session management approach is vulnerable to session hijacking.

remediation_backlog.title: Refactor Session Management
remediation_backlog.problem_statement: The current session management approach is insecure and vulnerable to hijacking.
remediation_backlog.risk_if_unaddressed: Potential for unauthorized access and data breaches.
remediation_backlog.suggested_approach: Implement secure session management using Python Flask sessions.
success_criteria: Session management is secure and resistant to hijacking.
User sessions are properly authenticated and terminated.

agent_results.summary: Extracted 8 functional requirements, 5 non-functional requirements, 5 risks, 2 clarifications, 0 failed quality gates [software-general-v1]

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to Python, ensuring backward compatibility and documenting functionality.
requirements_understanding: The legacy codebase involves session management, customer login, and order processing.
The modernization must preserve the existing functionality and session handling logic.
The system must be containerized for local testing using Docker.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Translate ASP session and application state management to Python using Flask or Django.
Use Python's built-in data structures to replace VBScript dictionaries.
Implement a RESTful API for customer and order management.
clarifications_requested: Is there a preferred Python framework (Flask or Django) for the implementation?
Are there any specific security standards to adhere to beyond general best practices?

output.executive_summary: This project involves modernizing a legacy ASP codebase to Python, ensuring feature parity and backward compatibility, with deployment in a Docker environment.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement session management to track active sessions and user authentication status.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are initiated upon user login and terminated upon logout.
Total active sessions are tracked and displayed.
User authentication status is maintained across requests.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication
functional_requirements.description: Implement user login functionality with session-based authentication.
acceptance_criteria: User is prompted for a username upon accessing the customer page.
Successful login sets the session as authenticated and stores the username.
Failed login attempts are redirected with an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Management
functional_requirements.description: Display a list of customers stored in the application state.
acceptance_criteria: Customers are displayed in a tabular format with ID and Name columns.
Customer data is retrieved from an in-memory data structure.
The page is accessible only to authenticated users.

functional_requirements.title: Order Creation
functional_requirements.description: Implement functionality to create new orders for customers.
acceptance_criteria: Order creation requires customer selection, status, and total amount.
Orders are stored in an in-memory data structure with a unique ID.
Invalid order submissions are redirected with an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Order Update
functional_requirements.description: Implement functionality to update the status of existing orders.
acceptance_criteria: Order status can be updated to NEW, PROCESSING, or CLOSED.
Updates are reflected in the in-memory data structure.
Invalid updates are redirected with an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging to provide feedback to users.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are displayed after redirects.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages support success and error types.

functional_requirements.title: HTML Encoding
functional_requirements.description: Ensure all user inputs and outputs are HTML encoded to prevent XSS.
acceptance_criteria: All dynamic content is HTML encoded before rendering.
User inputs are sanitized to prevent script injection.
Encoding is applied consistently across all pages.

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Deploy the modernized application in a Docker container for local testing.
acceptance_criteria: The application runs successfully in a Docker container.
All dependencies are included in the Docker image.
The Docker setup supports local testing and development.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should handle at least 100 concurrent sessions without performance degradation.
acceptance_criteria: Application response time remains under 200ms with 100 concurrent sessions.
Memory usage remains stable under load.
No session data loss occurs under load.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure secure handling of user data and session information.
non_functional_requirements.metric: No security vulnerabilities in OWASP Top 10
acceptance_criteria: No SQL injection vulnerabilities are present.
Session data is protected against hijacking.
User data is encrypted in transit.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be scalable to support future growth.
acceptance_criteria: Application architecture supports horizontal scaling.
Database queries are optimized for large datasets.
Load balancing is implemented for high availability.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available 99.9% of the time.
acceptance_criteria: Automated tests cover 90% of the codebase.
Downtime is minimized during deployments.
Error handling is implemented for all critical operations.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be user-friendly and intuitive.
acceptance_criteria: User interface is consistent and intuitive.
Feedback is collected and addressed in iterative improvements.
Documentation is provided for all user-facing features.

side_effects: Sets application name and initializes session count

assumptions: The modernization will use Flask as the Python framework unless specified otherwise.
Existing business logic will be preserved in the new implementation.
The application will be containerized using Docker for local testing.

risks.description: Potential data loss during the transition from ASP to Python.
risks.mitigation: Implement comprehensive data migration tests and backups.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities introduced during modernization.
risks.mitigation: Conduct thorough security audits and code reviews.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to inefficient Python code.
risks.mitigation: Optimize code and conduct performance testing.

risks.description: Compatibility issues with existing client systems.
risks.mitigation: Ensure backward compatibility and provide thorough testing.

risks.description: Docker configuration issues leading to deployment failures.
risks.mitigation: Use standard Docker practices and conduct deployment tests.

out_of_scope: Integration with external systems not mentioned in the legacy code.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Python. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.
assumptions: The modernization will use Flask as the Python framework unless specified otherwise.
Existing business logic will be preserved in the new implementation.
The application will be containerized using Docker for local testing.

agent_results.summary: Modular-Monolith architecture with 4 services on None

output.overview: This architecture modernizes a legacy ASP application to a Python-based modular monolith using Flask. It maintains backward compatibility while optimizing for latency, security, and scalability. The system is containerized using Docker for local testing and development.

services.name: Session Management Service
services.responsibility: Manage user sessions and authentication status.

services.name: Flash Messaging Service
services.responsibility: Provide feedback to users through flash messages.

scalability.caching_strategy: Redis for session and data caching

data_flow.description: Customer data is used for order creation.
Order creation feedback is sent to users.

latency_optimizations: Use of Redis for caching session data

trade_offs.rationale: SQLite is lightweight and easy to set up for local testing.
Flask is lightweight and suitable for a modular monolith architecture.
Docker Compose is sufficient for local development and testing.

legacy_system.current_logic_summary: The legacy system is an ASP application managing sessions, customer data, and orders using VBScript and in-memory data structures.
key_logic_steps: Initialize application state and session count on start.
Authenticate users and manage session state.
Display customer data stored in memory.
Create and update orders with in-memory storage.
Provide user feedback through flash messages.

analyst_summary.overview: Analyst inference for vishakjai/legacyasptest: repository structure and sampled source files indicate a multi-module application with 0 discovered route hints. Objective alignment used: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Python. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for

team.name: Synthetix Modernization Team
team.description: Legacy modernization team focused on functional parity and migration safety.

1.persona: Prioritize legacy parity, interface contracts, backward compatibility, and modernization risk documentation.

2.persona: Map legacy flows to modern services while minimizing migration risk and preserving business behavior.

3.persona: Rewrite legacy logic with functional parity first, then improve modularity without changing behavior.

4.persona: Design low-risk schema/data migration scripts with rollback plans and validation checkpoints.

5.persona: Produce threat models, prioritized security controls, and release-gating recommendations.

6.persona: Run actionable checks, separate environment issues from code defects, and produce clear remediation guidance.

7.persona: Validate requirement coverage clearly for business stakeholders with traceable evidence.

8.persona: Prefer local Docker deployability, deterministic health checks, and clear run instructions.

conversion_to_technical_requirements: Translate ASP session and application state management to Python using Flask or Django.
Use Python's built-in data structures to replace VBScript dictionaries.
Implement a RESTful API for customer and order management.
clarifications_requested: Is there a preferred Python framework (Flask or Django) for the implementation?
Are there any specific security standards to adhere to beyond general best practices?

analyst_output.executive_summary: This project involves modernizing a legacy ASP codebase to Python, ensuring feature parity and backward compatibility, with deployment in a Docker environment.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement session management to track active sessions and user authentication status.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are initiated upon user login and terminated upon logout.
Total active sessions are tracked and displayed.
User authentication status is maintained across requests.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication
functional_requirements.description: Implement user login functionality with session-based authentication.
acceptance_criteria: User is prompted for a username upon accessing the customer page.
Successful login sets the session as authenticated and stores the username.
Failed login attempts are redirected with an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Management
functional_requirements.description: Display a list of customers stored in the application state.
acceptance_criteria: Customers are displayed in a tabular format with ID and Name columns.
Customer data is retrieved from an in-memory data structure.
The page is accessible only to authenticated users.

functional_requirements.title: Order Creation
functional_requirements.description: Implement functionality to create new orders for customers.
acceptance_criteria: Order creation requires customer selection, status, and total amount.
Orders are stored in an in-memory data structure with a unique ID.
Invalid order submissions are redirected with an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Order Update
functional_requirements.description: Implement functionality to update the status of existing orders.
acceptance_criteria: Order status can be updated to NEW, PROCESSING, or CLOSED.
Updates are reflected in the in-memory data structure.
Invalid updates are redirected with an error message.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging to provide feedback to users.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are displayed after redirects.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages support success and error types.

functional_requirements.title: HTML Encoding
functional_requirements.description: Ensure all user inputs and outputs are HTML encoded to prevent XSS.
acceptance_criteria: All dynamic content is HTML encoded before rendering.
User inputs are sanitized to prevent script injection.
Encoding is applied consistently across all pages.

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Deploy the modernized application in a Docker container for local testing.
acceptance_criteria: The application runs successfully in a Docker container.
All dependencies are included in the Docker image.
The Docker setup supports local testing and development.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should handle at least 100 concurrent sessions without performance degradation.
acceptance_criteria: Application response time remains under 200ms with 100 concurrent sessions.
Memory usage remains stable under load.
No session data loss occurs under load.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure secure handling of user data and session information.
non_functional_requirements.metric: No security vulnerabilities in OWASP Top 10
acceptance_criteria: No SQL injection vulnerabilities are present.
Session data is protected against hijacking.
User data is encrypted in transit.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be scalable to support future growth.
acceptance_criteria: Application architecture supports horizontal scaling.
Database queries are optimized for large datasets.
Load balancing is implemented for high availability.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available 99.9% of the time.
acceptance_criteria: Automated tests cover 90% of the codebase.
Downtime is minimized during deployments.
Error handling is implemented for all critical operations.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be user-friendly and intuitive.
acceptance_criteria: User interface is consistent and intuitive.
Feedback is collected and addressed in iterative improvements.
Documentation is provided for all user-facing features.

side_effects: Sets application name and initializes session count

assumptions: The modernization will use Flask as the Python framework unless specified otherwise.
Existing business logic will be preserved in the new implementation.
The application will be containerized using Docker for local testing.

risks.description: Potential data loss during the transition from ASP to Python.
risks.mitigation: Implement comprehensive data migration tests and backups.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities introduced during modernization.
risks.mitigation: Conduct thorough security audits and code reviews.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to inefficient Python code.
risks.mitigation: Optimize code and conduct performance testing.

risks.description: Compatibility issues with existing client systems.
risks.mitigation: Ensure backward compatibility and provide thorough testing.

risks.description: Docker configuration issues leading to deployment failures.
risks.mitigation: Use standard Docker practices and conduct deployment tests.

out_of_scope: Integration with external systems not mentioned in the legacy code.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Python. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.
assumptions: The modernization will use Flask as the Python framework unless specified otherwise.
Existing business logic will be preserved in the new implementation.
The application will be containerized using Docker for local testing.

Map acceptance criteria to executable test types.

scenarios.name: Successful login
gherkin: Given a user is on the login page
When they enter valid credentials
Then they are redirected to the customers page

scenarios.name: Create a new order
gherkin: Given a user is authenticated
When they submit a valid order form
Then the order is created and stored

scenarios.name: Update order status
gherkin: Given an existing order
When the status is changed
Then the order status is updated in the system

scenarios.name: Track active sessions
gherkin: Given multiple users are logged in
When a new session starts
Then the total session count is incremented

relationships: LegacyInput contract must map deterministically to ModernizedOutput contract

non_negotiables: Define explicit error handling and observability requirements.
Map acceptance criteria to executable test types.

architect_output.overview: This architecture modernizes a legacy ASP application to a Python-based modular monolith using Flask. It maintains backward compatibility while optimizing for latency, security, and scalability. The system is containerized using Docker for local testing and development.

services.name: Session Management Service
services.responsibility: Manage user sessions and authentication status.

services.name: Flash Messaging Service
services.responsibility: Provide feedback to users through flash messages.

scalability.caching_strategy: Redis for session and data caching

data_flow.description: Customer data is used for order creation.
Order creation feedback is sent to users.

latency_optimizations: Use of Redis for caching session data

trade_offs.rationale: SQLite is lightweight and easy to set up for local testing.
Flask is lightweight and suitable for a modular monolith architecture.
Docker Compose is sufficient for local development and testing.

legacy_system.current_logic_summary: The legacy system is an ASP application managing sessions, customer data, and orders using VBScript and in-memory data structures.
key_logic_steps: Initialize application state and session count on start.
Authenticate users and manage session state.
Display customer data stored in memory.
Create and update orders with in-memory storage.
Provide user feedback through flash messages.
